prompt: <description>Section 1: Part 1 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 0.75 units by 0.75 units by 0.125 units. 1.1 Creating the coordinate system: Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin of the CAD model with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 1.2 Sketching the base of the prism (face_1): Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 lines, forming a rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.75, 0.25] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.75, 0.25], End Point: [0.75, 0.625] - Line 3: Start Point: [0.75, 0.625], End Point: [0.0, 0.625] - Line 4: Start Point: [0.0, 0.625], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] 1.3 Extruding the base: Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis to create the prism with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.125 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body Section 2: Part 2 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. The dimensions of the front face are approximately 2:3 in height and width. The side faces are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the front face. The top and bottom faces are flat and parallel to each other. The object is centered in the image. 2.1 Creating the coordinate system: Create a new coordinate system at the origin of the CAD model with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.125] (This matches the top of Part 1) 2.2 Sketching the base of the angled prism (face_1): Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional, tapered rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. 1. Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a line from (0.0, 0.25) to (0.25, 0.0). 2. Continue creating the sketch by drawing a line from (0.25, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.0). 3. Draw a line from (0.5, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.5). 4. Draw a line from (0.5, 0.5) to (0.0, 0.5). 5. Complete the sketch with a line from (0.0, 0.5) to (0.0, 0.25), creating a closed loop. The sketch has 5 lines, forming a single face. Now, extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model: - Set the extrude_depth_towards_normal to 0.5 and extrude_depth_opposite_normal to 0.0. - Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.5 (sketch_scale). - Create a new solid body (NewBodyFeatureOperation) with the extruded sketch. **Part 2: Construct an additional three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** 1. Create a new coordinate system at (0.5, 0.0, 0.0) with no rotation. 2. Create the first face of the sketch with a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.25, 0.0). 3. The sketch has 4 lines forming a single face. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model: - Set the extrude_depth_towards_normal to 0.25 and extrude_depth_opposite_normal to 0.0. - Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.5. - Join the extruded sketch to the previously created solid body. By following these instructions, you will create a three-dimensional, tapered rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.</description>
